actor_awards.notes: Best known for her dual role as Mary Shelley and the Monster's Mate in 'Bride of Frankenstein' (1935). She was married to actor Charles Laughton and often appeared alongside him. She won the Golden Globe for Best Supporting Actress for 'Witness for the Prosecution' (1957).

filmography.title: Bride of Frankenstein
filmography.role_description: She plays both the author of the original novel in the prologue and the hissed, shock-haired mate created for the monster.
filmography.plot: Dr. Frankenstein, goaded by an even madder scientist, builds his monster a mate.

filmography.title: Witness for the Prosecution
filmography.role_description: The chatty and overprotective nurse who tries to keep the ailing barrister Sir Wilfrid Robarts (played by her husband Charles Laughton) from overworking.
filmography.plot: A veteran British barrister must defend his client in a murder trial that has surprise after surprise.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actress; Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: Mary Poppins
filmography.role_description: The disgruntled nanny who quits the Banks household at the beginning of the film, paving the way for Mary Poppins.
filmography.plot: A magical nanny employs music and adventure to help two neglected children become closer to their father.

filmography.title: Come to the Stable
filmography.role_description: An artist and religious painter who lets two nuns stay in her stable while they try to build a hospital.
filmography.plot: Two French nuns arrive in a small New England town with a plan to build a hospital, despite having no money and facing local skepticism.

filmography.title: The Private Life of Henry VIII
filmography.role_description: The German fourth wife of Henry VIII, whom she outwits by playing cards and agreeing to an annulment.
filmography.plot: King Henry VIII moves through several wives in his quest for an heir, starting with the execution of Anne Boleyn.

filmography.title: The Spiral Staircase
filmography.role_description: The cook and housekeeper in a mansion where a serial killer targeting disabled women is on the loose.
filmography.plot: A serial killer targets a mute servant girl in a New England mansion.

filmography.title: The Big Clock
filmography.role_description: An eccentric artist who becomes a key witness in a murder investigation involving a magazine tycoon.
filmography.plot: A magazine tycoon commits a murder and frames an innocent man, who must then lead the investigation to clear his name.

filmography.title: Bell, Book and Candle
filmography.role_description: The mischievous witch aunt of the main character who uses magic to cause trouble.
filmography.plot: A modern-day witch casts a spell on a neighbor to make him fall in love with her, but she risks losing her powers if she falls in love back.

filmography.title: Murder by Death
filmography.role_description: A parody of Miss Marple, she is a famous British detective invited to a dinner party to solve a murder.
filmography.plot: Five famous literary detective characters and their sidekicks are invited to a bizarre mansion to solve an even stranger mystery.

filmography.title: Lassie Come Home
filmography.role_description: The mother of the boy who owns Lassie, forced to sell the dog due to financial hardship.
filmography.plot: After her destitute family is forced to sell her, a collie named Lassie escapes from her new owner and begins a long trek from Scotland to her Yorkshire home.

filmography.title: The Bishop's Wife
filmography.role_description: The bishop's cynical but loyal housekeeper who gets caught up in the divine intervention.
filmography.plot: An angel in human form enters the life of a bishop in order to help him build a new cathedral and repair his fractured marriage.

filmography.title: The Razor's Edge
filmography.role_description: The social secretary to the snobbish Elliott Templeton.
filmography.plot: A disillusioned WWI veteran travels the world seeking spiritual enlightenment, while his friends and former fiancée pursue wealth and status.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress (Anne Baxter)

filmography.title: The Inspector General
filmography.role_description: The mayor's flirtatious wife who tries to seduce the man she believes is the Inspector General.
filmography.plot: An illiterate tonic salesman is mistaken for a royal inspector general in a corrupt village.

filmography.title: Blackbeard's Ghost
filmography.role_description: A descendant of Blackbeard's crew who runs the inn where the pirate's ghost appears.
filmography.plot: The ghost of the pirate Blackbeard returns to our time and is forced to help the track team of a small college.

filmography.title: That Darn Cat!
filmography.role_description: The snoopy, gossip-loving neighbor of the family that owns the mischievous cat.
filmography.plot: A woman uses her Siamese cat to help the FBI solve a kidnapping case.

filmography.title: Willard
filmography.role_description: The nagging, invalid mother of the socially awkward Willard.
filmography.plot: A young man with an affinity for rats uses them to exact revenge on those who have wronged him.

filmography.title: The Secret Garden
filmography.role_description: The kind Yorkshire housemaid who helps Mary Lennox adjust to life at Misselthwaite Manor.
filmography.plot: An orphaned girl discovers a hidden garden and helps her sickly cousin regain his health.

filmography.title: David Copperfield
filmography.role_description: The Micawber family's maid, a small comedic role in the classic Dickens adaptation.
filmography.plot: A gentle orphan discovers life and love in an indifferent adult world.

filmography.title: Rembrandt
filmography.role_description: The maid and later mistress of the famous painter Rembrandt after his wife's death.
filmography.plot: A biopic of the Dutch painter Rembrandt van Rijn, focusing on his later years and relationships.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Mystery Street
filmography.role_description: A blackmailing landlady who steals a gun and becomes a secondary victim in a murder mystery.
filmography.plot: A skeleton is found on a beach, and Harvard forensic scientists work with the police to identify the victim and catch the killer.

filmography.title: Androcles and the Lion
filmography.role_description: The nagging wife of Androcles who drives him to run away, leading to his encounter with the lion.
filmography.plot: A Christian tailor and a lion he befriended are captured by Romans and thrown into the Colosseum.

filmography.title: Les Misérables
filmography.role_description: The housekeeper to the Bishop of Digne.
filmography.plot: A relentless police inspector pursues a former convict who has reinvented himself as a mayor and factory owner.

filmography.title: Naughty Marietta
filmography.role_description: The wife of the Governor in this operetta film.
filmography.plot: A French princess flees an arranged marriage by traveling to New Orleans, where she falls for a mercenary scout.

filmography.title: Me, Natalie
filmography.role_description: The eccentric landlady of the main character, Natalie.
filmography.plot: A homely young woman moves out of her parents' house to find herself in Greenwich Village.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress (Patty Duke)

filmography.title: Easy Come, Easy Go
filmography.role_description: An eccentric yoga teacher who aids Elvis Presley's character.
filmography.plot: A Navy frogman discovers a treasure chest in a sunken ship and works to retrieve it upon his discharge.

filmography.title: Arnold
filmography.role_description: A family member involved in a macabre plot to inherit money from a dead man.
filmography.plot: Upon his death, a man arranges for his body to be preserved and his family to remain with it to inherit his fortune, while traps pick them off.

filmography.title: Terror in the Wax Museum
filmography.role_description: A wealthy woman involved in the ownership dispute of a wax museum where murders occur.
filmography.plot: A murderer is on the loose in a wax museum where the figures of famous killers are displayed.
